p: The primary end points were the safety and tolerability of hESC-derived RPE cells as defined by the absence of any grade 2 or more (National Cancer Institute grading system) adverse event relating to the transplanted cells, any evidence that the cells were contaminated with an infectious agent, any evidence that the cells showed potential of tumorigenicity, or a combination thereof. Secondary end points included safety of the surgical procedure, dose selection for future studies, evidence of donor cell survival and engraftment in the target location, and retinal function as measured by electroretinography. Exploratory end points included VA, color discrimination, retinal sensitivity by perimetry, and quality of life (assessed with the 25-item National Eye Institute Visual Function Questionnaire).
